alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 9:02PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Orange, eastern Rutland and Windsor Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brookfield to near Barnard to near Ludlow. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Bradford, Thetford Hill State Park, Ludlow Village, Pomfret, Plymouth, Thetford, Hartland, Fairlee, Tunbridge, Sharon, Corinth Corners, Washington, Newbury, Newbury Village, Bridgewater, Baltimore, Springfield and West Windsor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 38. Interstate 91 between mile markers 43 and 49, between mile markers 51 and 61, between mile markers 63 and 71, near mile marker 73, and between mile markers 75 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor
